text: 140px The Takeda (竹田) ōke (princely house) was the tenth and youngest branch of the Japanese Imperial Family created from branches of the Fushimi-no-miya house. The Takeda-no-miya house was formed by Prince Tsunehisa, eldest son of Prince Kitashirakawa Yoshihisa (second Kitashirakawa-no-miya). He received the title Prince Takeda (Takeda-no-miya) and authorization to start a new branch of the Imperial Family in 1906. {| class=wikitable ! ||Name|| Born .||Succeeded|| Retired || Died |- | 1 |||| 1882 || 1906 || . || 1919 |- | 2 |||| 1909 || 1919 || 1947 || 1992 |- | 3 |||| 1940 || 1992 || . || . |- |} == References == Category:1906 establishments in Japan
title: Takeda-no-miya
